text: Frederic Henry LeweyHe is consistently referred to as "Lewy", although he changed his names during his years in the U.S, ending up with "Lewey". (born Friedrich Heinrich Lewy, January 28, 1885 - October 5, 1950) was a Jewish German-born American neurologist. He is best known for the discovery of Lewy bodies. ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1950 deaths Category:Scientists from California Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Neurologists Category:Scientists from Berlin
title: Frederic Lewy
